Subject: Several questions about surfreactor.m (cantera 1.5 Matlab demos)
Message-ID: <bnjjmm+9q6v@...>

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

From: "tengfei_liu1979" <lit1@...>
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=163817691
X-Yahoo-Profile: tengfei_liu1979
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 28 Oct 2003 10:55:09 -0000

Hi Dave,

I am a new cantera user and my major is chemical engineering. We are 
trying to develp a plug flow reactor model for catalytic (on Pt 
surface) partial methane oxidation, which can be expressed by : 
CH4+0.5O2=CO+2H2. I noticed that someone has already posted a 
message about PFR model and you mentioned that we can use dz=V(gas)
*dt to convert the zero-dimentional model to a plug flow reactor. 
Here, I have several questions about the zero dimentional model 
surfreactor.m:

1) Is the kinetics also valid for the Partial Oxidation of Methane 
on Pt surface, or, where did u get the original kinetics of the Pt 
combustion?

2) In surfreactor.m, you wrote:

t = 870.0;
gas = importPhase('ptcombust.cti','gas');

% set the initial conditions
set(gas,'T',t,'P',oneatm,'X','CH4:0.02, O2:0.21, N2:0.784');

surf = importInterface('ptcombust.cti','Pt_surf', gas);
setTemperature(surf, t);

Does this mean you set both the Pt wall surface and the inlet gas as 
the same temperature? If the answer is yes, why should we do like 
that, cause, I think the inlet gas might enter the reactor in a much 
lower temperature and be heated by the hotter wall until it reaches 
a considerable high temperature to ignite the reaction.

3) You wrote:

setArea(w, 1.0e-4);
setHeatTransferCoeff(w,0.1);

I am just wondering how the parameters, like 1.0e-4 and 0.1 comes 
from? Cause in our system, we might have significant different 
values of the catalyst surface area as well as the heat transfer 
coefficient.

Thank you very much for your time.


Tengfei

Dept. of Chemical Engineering,
University of Pittsburgh
